content.question: The location of point <math alttext="X"><mi>X</mi></math> in polar coordinates <math alttext="open parentheses r comma theta close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>θ</mi></mrow></mfenced></math> is <math alttext="open parentheses 1 comma fraction numerator 5 pi over denominator 6 end fraction close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>6</mn></mfrac></mrow></mfenced></math>. Which of the following describes the location of point <math alttext="X"><mi>X</mi></math> in rectangular coordinates <math alttext="open parentheses x comma y close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi></mrow></mfenced></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="open parentheses negative fraction numerator square root of 3 over denominator 2 end fraction comma 1 half close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mo>-</mo><mfrac><msqrt><mn>3</mn></msqrt><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo>,</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mrow></mfenced></math>

<math alttext="open parentheses fraction numerator square root of 3 over denominator 2 end fraction comma 1 half close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mfrac><msqrt><mn>3</mn></msqrt><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo>,</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mrow></mfenced></math>

<math alttext="open parentheses 1 half comma negative fraction numerator square root of 3 over denominator 2 end fraction close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo>,</mo><mo>-</mo><mfrac><msqrt><mn>3</mn></msqrt><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mrow></mfenced></math>

<math alttext="open parentheses 1 half comma fraction numerator square root of 3 over denominator 2 end fraction close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo>,</mo><mfrac><msqrt><mn>3</mn></msqrt><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mrow></mfenced></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="open parentheses negative fraction numerator square root of 3 over denominator 2 end fraction comma 1 half close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mo>-</mo><mfrac><msqrt><mn>3</mn></msqrt><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo>,</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mrow></mfenced></math>

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Express functions, equations, or expressions in analytically equivalent forms that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context.
